result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary R. Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two, or if not 10 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety- except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with agent approval.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
May transfer probation to county of residence.
35 days if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I&S for rule violations. With huber or electronic monitor if defendant qualifies under jail criteria.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:13 am  
State appears by ADA Lance Leonhard; Def appears in person with Atty Jay Kronenwetter.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent Cocaine/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
Ct. 2 (Possess with Intent LSD/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 3 (Possess with Intent Psilocin/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 4 (Possess with Intent THC/Repeater)>>AMEND to Misd. Possession of THC pursuant to 961.41(3g) and DELETE repeater enhancer. 
Ct. 5 (Possess Illegally Obtained Prescription/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
Amended Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent Cocaine)>>NO CONTEST. 
Amended Ct. 4 (Possession of THC)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
State makes statement. Atty Kronenwetter makes statement. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1>>SWH for 5 years probation - CONDITION of probation on this count ONLY: 1 year MCJ with huber or electronic monitor if def qualifies under jail criteria imposed and STAYED for rule violations. 
                           : On Ct. 4>>SWH for 1 year probation. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of probation on both: absolute sobriety except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with agent approval; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, 10 hours community service per week; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate; payment of court costs including DNA surcharges. 
COURT finds deft is entitled to 35 days jail credit if revoked. 
COURT notes def may transfer probation to county of residence.  
Adj: 10:37 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 5, 2014 at 10:00 am.

AMENDED $10,000.00 signature bond with first $2,500.00 in cash with co-signers.  Co-signers must be two family members at least two degree of kinship apart.  Shall not consume alcohol. Absolute sobriety. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents.   No contact with co-defendant(s): R.S. & M.M. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Dusk to dawn curfew (unless job otherwise does not honor that requirement).    Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202.
